questions.question: Following the fatal shark attack while surfing at Long Reef Beach near Dee Why, which organisation suspended water activities for the weekend?
questions.explanation: Surf Life Saving NSW announced that clubs in the area cancelled all water activity and training for the weekend after the suspected shark attack at Long Reef Beach; the other agencies responded or assisted but were not reported to have suspended club water activities.

questions.question: Following the Porepunkah shooting and the large manhunt for Dezi Freeman, what did Victoria Police announce within the last 48 hours?

answers.text: They reduced the search to fewer than 50 officers and stood down most resources
They offered up to A$1,000,000 for information leading to Freeman’s arrest
They announced Freeman had been captured and charged
They lifted the no‑fly/drone exclusion zone around Porepunkah

questions.explanation: Victoria Police announced a reward of up to A$1 million for information leading to Dezi Freeman’s arrest — the largest reward the state has offered for an arrest — while continuing a large-scale manhunt and warning the public not to search for him.

questions.question: In the recent manhunt for Dezi Freeman following the Porepunkah shootings, roughly how many officers did Victoria Police deploy to search the alpine bushland in north‑east Victoria?
questions.explanation: Victoria Police said the search for Dezi Freeman involved a large operation with more than 450 officers and specialised assets deployed to the rough alpine terrain around Porepunkah and the Victorian High Country.

questions.question: In the Rugby Championship match in Townsville where the Wallabies came from 21–7 down to beat Argentina 28–24, which player scored the winning try deep into added time?
questions.explanation: Angus Bell, the Wallabies prop, scored the decisive try in the sixth minute of added time (80+6) to complete the comeback and secure a 28–24 victory over Argentina in Townsville.

questions.question: Which of the following aircraft was part of the Australian Defence Force aerial display at Brisbane's Riverfire event?
questions.explanation: ABC News and official RAAF/Defence media confirm the ADF aerial display at Riverfire 2025 included EA-18G Growlers (alongside a C-17A Globemaster III and a C-27J Spartan). The EA-18G Growler option is therefore correct; the other listed aircraft are not reported as participants in the Riverfire 2025 display.
